sanskrit_verse:
सदृशं तु प्रकुर्याद्यं गुणदोषविचक्षणम् ।
पुत्रं पुत्रगुणैर्युक्तं स विज्ञेयश्च कृत्रिमः ॥ ९.१६९॥
transliteration:
sadṛśaṃ tu prakuryād yaṃ guṇadoṣavicakṣaṇam | 
putraṃ putraguṇairyuktaṃ sa vijñeyaś ca kṛtrimaḥ || 9.169 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who acts in accordance with the discernment of qualities and defects, and who aligns a son with the inherent capacities of that son — such a one is known as artificial or contrived.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from capacity recognition, not imposition
Causation arises through alignment with intrinsic dharma, not external compulsion
Capacity-based responsibility requires conscious matching of action to innate nature
Restoration logic demands re-alignment with svadharma, not behavioral correction
Consciousness alignment occurs when roles are assigned based on revealed capability, not assumed lineage
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual demonstrates inherent incapacity for a role, THEN reassignment MUST occur without degradation
IF role assignment contradicts observable capacity, THEN institutional misalignment SHALL be declared
IF a child's conduct reflects untrained ignorance rather than willful defiance, THEN guardianship failure SHALL be adjudicated prior to intervention
IF societal function depends on artificial attribution of competence, THEN systemic realignment SHALL precede adjudication
IF identity is imposed contrary to manifest dharma, THEN restoration protocol SHALL activate immediately
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that any judicial determination assigning roles or responsibilities contrary to manifest capacity constitutes institutional failure. The threshold of responsibility lies in recognizing true capacity, not enforcing assumed status. Authority hierarchies must reflect actual alignment with svadharma, and restoration occurs by removing artificial impositions, not punishing deviations.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that assigning unnatural roles creates distortion in consciousness flow. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that misaligned roles produce cascading disharmony. Proportional responsibility rests with those imposing false identities, not with those unable to perform artificially assigned functions. The non-punitive reality rule affirms that correction comes through realignment, not penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate capacity-assessment process before role confirmation
Activate guardian-realization protocol upon detection of mismatched assignments
Implement svadharma-revelation practices for all affected parties
Reconstruct institutional frameworks where artificial attribution prevails
Establish continuous alignment monitoring to prevent recurrence
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores alignment with intrinsic capacity, abolishes artificial attribution, and affirms consciousness as the sole adjudicator. There is no punishment; there is only awakening.
